[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Struct: Runner] [Boolean Logic Error] Can the per_function boolean be manipulated between calls to cause mixed per-function and per-module benchmarking with data corruption? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Struct: BenchmarkData] [Duration Overflow] Can the usize duration field store durations that overflow when converted to other time units in downstream processing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Struct: BenchmarkData] [Status Enumeration] Should status be an enum instead of String to prevent invalid status values from causing logic errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Configuration: backend.hard_timeout_secs] Can an attacker craft a TOML config that overrides the hard_timeout_secs = 60 setting to disable timeout protection and cause infinite hangs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Configuration: backend.global_timeout_overwrite] Does setting global_timeout_overwrite = false at line 164 properly prevent config-based timeout manipulation, or can other config fields override this? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Configuration: backend.vc_timeout] Can the vc_timeout value of 400 be overridden through config injection to cause verification timeouts that hide errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Configuration: backend.proc_cores] Can an attacker override proc_cores = 1 to enable parallel execution that triggers race conditions in the Move Prover? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Configuration: skip_attribute_checks] Does skip_attribute_checks = true at line 148 disable security-critical attribute validation that could allow malicious Move attributes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Configuration: custom_natives] Can the custom_natives template loaded from aptos-natives.bpl be tampered with to inject malicious Boogie code into verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Configuration: move_sources] Can appending to move_sources without validation allow inclusion of malicious Move files that exploit Move Prover bugs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Configuration: move_deps] Can move_deps include directories with malicious dependency files that override legitimate dependencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Configuration: set_quiet] Does options.set_quiet() properly suppress all debug output, or can verbose logging leak sensitive information about verification internals? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [Configuration: setup_logging] Can options.setup_logging() be manipulated to redirect logs to attacker-controlled files or network endpoints? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [File I/O: LineWriter] Can the LineWriter buffer sensitive data that remains in memory after benchmark completion, creating a memory disclosure vulnerability? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [File I/O: File::create] Does File::create() follow symlinks, allowing an attacker to overwrite arbitrary files by creating a symlink at the expected output path? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [File I/O: writeln! macro] Can the writeln! macro calls fail silently without proper error propagation, causing incomplete benchmark data files? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-prover/lab/src/benchmark.rs] [File I/O: StandardStream] Can StandardStream::stderr() be redirected to a file under attacker control to capture sensitive error messages? (Medium)
